channel.title: Javax.sound.sampled
channel.description: I forgot the package name... But I was wondering how to use the method to play a song after another one ends? Or the method for listening on the song to find out WHEN it ends.. Sorry if i'm not making sense ~_~

item.title: Javax.sound.sampled
item.dc:creator: @ravekitty ravekitty
item.description:
@ravekitty wrote:

[quote=“AtomicInt_, post:7, topic:450938”]okay, what do you mean by slower…?

either package is certainly not slowed that the other.[/quote]
It could be the way i’m trying to use it…
But javax takes a lot longer to actually open and play the sample then sun.audio.
The purpose of this is actually rsps, but I’m interested in learning more about it so I posted here… =p

Read full topic

item.title: Javax.sound.sampled
item.dc:creator: @slavemaster veer
item.description:
@slavemaster wrote:

IIRC you can use a LineListener to respond to audio events, as documented here. (obligatory reference to Sun’s tutorial) You should specifically focus on STOP events, so that you can know when to reset your data line or start another.

Read full topic

item.title: Javax.sound.sampled
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

i wonder if java’s sound package has event triggers (sample start/pause/end). that could make it very easy for you.

Read full topic
